kv18.1:1.1_0: should not correct them like this:
kv18.1:1.4_0: Do the Buddhas, villages, towns, and capital cities of the villages, towns, and capital cities, countries.
kv18.1:1.6_0: If he has arrived at the villages, towns, and capital cities of Kusāvatī, he is Revata at the villages of towns, saying,
kv18.1:1.7_0: “The Blessed One, the Buddha is awakened.”
kv18.1:2.1_0: should not correct them like this:
kv18.1:2.4_0: Hasn’t the Buddha was born in the Bodhi tree—haddy of the past and the future—who can rolled forth the Wheel of Dhamma was rolled forth by the Buddha and fully extinguished.
kv18.1:2.6_0: If the Buddha was born on his mother’s side, the Buddha said,
kv18.1:2.7_0: “The Blessed One, the Buddha is awakened.”
kv18.1:3.12_0: He stands by the Buddha, the people got upset.
kv18.1:3.1_0: should not correct them like this:
kv18.1:3.5_0: “Mendicants, at one time I was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.”
kv18.1:3.6_0: “Mendicants, at one time, when I was first awakened, I was staying near Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.”
kv18.1:3.7_0: “Mendicants, at one time I was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.”
kv18.1:3.8_0: “Mendicants, at one time I was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.”
kv18.1:3.9_0: “Mendicants, at one time I was staying near Vesālī in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.”
kv18.1:4.1_0: the Buddha shines with a human being.
kv18.1:4.3_0: Wouldn’t the Buddha promise, and lives having mastered the world?
kv18.1:4.5_0: Rough the Buddha was born and grew up in the world, he lives having mastered the world, and the world does not cling to me.
kv18.1:4.6_0: “The Blessed One, the Buddha is awakened.”
kv18.1:4.7_0: The story at the Book of the human beings is finished.
